placeInfo: {'id': '9981243', 'name': 'Fort Bazaar', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 636, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026914, 'longitude': 80.21762, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d9981243-Reviews-Fort_Bazaar-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://teardrop-hotels.com/fort-bazaar/', 'address': '26 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '26 Church Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 102, 'count5': 513}}
text:
This is a charming boutique hotel in the UNESCO heritage city of Galle, Sri Lanka. The staff is terrific. They are very eager to make you feel at home. Rooms are large and tastefully decorated and the wet room bathroom has a great shower. Complimentary tea at 3:30 is included and the morning breakfast was great. The coffee was delicious! Best coffee I had in Sri Lanka!
There is a bell in your room you can “push for champagne”. The young bellman gave us these instructions. “You can push this bell for champagne and my colleague will bring you a glass. But unfortunately not today because it is Full Moon day” 
Full moon day is a Buddhist holiday known as Poya - and no alcohol is sold that day. I guess we could have tried it in the morning!
title: Charming hotel -push button for champagne unless it’s full moon day!

placeInfo: {'id': '9981243', 'name': 'Fort Bazaar', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 636, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026914, 'longitude': 80.21762, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d9981243-Reviews-Fort_Bazaar-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://teardrop-hotels.com/fort-bazaar/', 'address': '26 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '26 Church Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 102, 'count5': 513}}
text:
From the moment we arrived at this luxurious boutique hotel in a beautifully restored merchant’s house we really felt like honoured guests. The staff were amazingly helpful and friendly and the whole place is absolutely gorgeous and very stylish.

Our first floor bedroom was stunning and had a lovely lounge area with a selection of books. The bathroom was also indulgent with double basins, a big shower and a bath with bath salts and even a candle (and matches). In the dressing area, there was plenty of wardrobe space, a fridge, kettle, coffee machine, hairdryer - everything had been thought of and it was all perfect!

The food in the Church Street Social restaurant was excellent - whatever time of day. And the bar (with its Happy Hour) did great cocktails and drinks!

I can’t think of anything else the team could do to improve this lovely hotel - it’s perfect! And we will be back next time we’re in Sri Lanka!
title: Perfection!

placeInfo: {'id': '9981243', 'name': 'Fort Bazaar', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 636, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026914, 'longitude': 80.21762, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d9981243-Reviews-Fort_Bazaar-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://teardrop-hotels.com/fort-bazaar/', 'address': '26 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '26 Church Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 102, 'count5': 513}}
text:
The Fort Bazaar is a gorgeous hotel in a former Dutch merchant's house. Situated on Church Street, it is in the heart of old Galle. From the moment you walk into the hotel you realise this is a wonderfully relaxing space in the midst of the buzzy town.

The rooms face into an airy inner courtyard. Our room had a four poster bed, was modern and very tastefully decorated.

The bed was comfortable. The shower products of a good quality.

Given that all the bedrooms face the courtyard the windows are frosted and this limits the natural light in the room.

The restaurant has outside, streetside seating as well as indoor seating. Dinner was excellent - we ate crispy barramundi with chips. The batter was crispy and not greasy as were the chips.

There is also a separate bar.

The breakfast is not a buffet but is a la carte (at a fixed price). The fruit platter starter was excellent and included pineapple. The eggs benedict with avacado was also excellent.
title: Beautiful Hotel in a great location

text:
We stayed for one night in December, and found Galle to be a charming little town, and Fort Bazar, a great place to stay. The air conditioning in our first room on the ground floor didn’t work, so they happily moved us to one upstairs (14) and the rooms are all decorated in a lovely, simple (almost Scandinavian) style – lovely blues and greens. The bathrooms are great and the service very good. 

The whole place has a nice vibe to it, and feels fresh and spotlessly clean. A really great option for a short stay in town.
title: Perfect Option in Galle

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
text:
The Bartizan Hotel is ideally situated within the historic Galle Fort in Sri Lanka, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Its prime location provides easy access to the fort's ramparts and Pedlar Street, which is just around the corner. This makes it convenient for guests to explore the charming streets and cultural attractions of Galle Fort.

The rooms at The Bartizan Hotel offer a pleasing blend of modern comfort and historic charm. Each room is tastefully decorated, featuring elegant furnishings and thoughtful details that reflect the rich history of Galle. We stayed in a suite with a private balcony overlooking the ocean, providing a serene and picturesque setting. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring a restful night's sleep. However, the air conditioner struggled to keep the room cool during the warm nights.

The hotel does not have a traditional restaurant, but a courtyard area with café tables serviced by a competent team in the kitchen. The food offers a delightful dining experience with a focus on fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Despite the lack of a formal restaurant, the culinary offerings were impressive and thoroughly enjoyable.

The service at The Bartizan Hotel is wonderful. The staff are warm, friendly, and go out of their way to ensure that every guest feels welcome and well taken care of. From personalized recommendations for local attractions to thoughtful touches throughout our stay, the level of hospitality was outstanding.

The Bartizan Hotel offers a unique and memorable experience in the heart of Galle Fort. The combination of its historic charm, luxurious accommodations, and outstanding service makes it a standout choice for anyone visiting Galle. Highly recommended for a truly special stay in a remarkable location.
title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in Galle

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
text:
Everything about our stay was fantastic. 

Firstly, the team of staff are so lovely and accommodating - they couldn’t do enough for us and were always smiling. 

The rooms are comfy and spotlessly clean.

Breakfast was outstanding. There are options to suit all (2 westernised options and 2 local) - all were delicious. 

The location is perfect. There is a gorgeous roof terrace with sun set views. 

If I am back in Galle in the future, I will be sure to stay here again. 

Thank you so much to all the staff - 4 very happy travellers!!
title: Would recommend to anybody visiting Galle

text:
Awesome stay, we absolutely loved it. 
Stylish Boutique Hotel , huge rooms & really nicely styled. Lovely smelling bath products! Staff were friendly and very nice. Great breakfast and excellent location. our room had a sea view and a full terrace. Amazing! Highly recommended!
title: A must stay within the Fort

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
roomTip: Just be mindful of the fact that they don’t serve any sort of food after about 4pm if ur travelling with kids.. rest all good!
text:
We stayed one night at the bartizan.. the hotel has lovely vibes , and is a great place to stay . It’s walking distance from all the restaurants, hardly a 2 min walk. Also it’s across the street from where u can walk/ view the ocean so location is brilliant. 
Our room was really spacious and well kept. Only suggestion I would have for them is to put another smaller air conditioner in the section with the 2 other beds as it’s quite hot there, coz ac air doesn’t reach. The balcony is of a nice size and loo is 👍👍
The breakfast was super. You have to order when u reach so that they can have it ready morning. It’s a small operation it seems..
A good thing to note is that once the kitchen is shut then there’s literally nothing for u to eat, which means by 4pm I think.. u need to get it from outside. They did say they serve lunch but I’m really not sure..
That said, it’s very very close to all the restaurants so manageable .
Would definitely stay here again ..

Breakfast they served during our stay was delicious and loved every bit of it.
We wish the whole team all the very best and highly recommend Bartizan for anyone.

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
text:
We stayed three nights here whilst touring. The property is boutique with some charm and very well located in the old town. We were kindly upgraded to balcony room with seaview which was appreciated. Room was quirky, huge and well equipped, only thing missing was a tv but that did not trouble us. Staff were friendly and helpful and it was nice to be offered breakfast on our balcony. I even managed a couple of swims on little beach opposite the hotel. 
Only downside was that the property is popular for wedding/fashion photoshoots in the courtyard (where guests eat) and turret beside our room, and there were several such over our stay which we found intrusive. I was told this started over covid restrictions to bring in cash, which is understandable, but then continued. Seems like owners are selling the same small facilities twice.
title: Charming property in good location.

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
text: We had a lovely stay at the Bartizan, the staff were so helpful and always there to give recommendations, the room had everything you needed and a nice terrace for having breakfast. The hotel is close to lots of restaurants and shops in galle and we would definitely recommend it!
title: Lovely hotel with amazing staff

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}

Staff were incredibly helpful and Carl especially went out of his way to make us feel comfortable and at home. Large room with very comfortable bed. Lighting was a little too dim for our needs. I would be glad to recommend the Bartizan to friends. Thank you to all staff for making us feel at home.

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
roomTip: Highly recommend watching the sunset from the top balcony
text:
Our time at The Bartizan Hotel was absolutely fantastic. It is located in the fort right by the ocean and close to the Pedlar’s Inn Cafe. We were treated to a gorgeous room with a private balcony overlooking the ocean, giving us front-row seats to the gorgeous Galle sunsets every evening.
Kal, one of the Managers, was extremely professional and helpful. He took care of every detail, including arranging an early takeaway breakfast for us before our safari. His attentive service made our stay even more special.
The hotel itself is simply stunning – clean, spacious, and beautifully designed, which provides some memorable photo spots. 
I highly recommend the Sri Lankan breakfast options which were absolutely delicious. Overall our stay at The Bartizan Hotel was amazing and the perfect start to our Sri Lankan holiday.
title: Perfect Hotel for a Galle Sunset

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
text:
We spent two nights at The Bartizan and thoroughly enjoyed our time at the hotel. The location is absolutely wonderful, right opposite the Galle Fort walls, and with views over the ocean. It's also just a short walk to all the action on Pedlar St. 

The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, however, they're starting to feel their age a little. Additionally, the AC isn't powerful enough to cool the entire room (we stayed in a larger suite), so at times it was quite hot. 

The breakfast is exceptional, with  Sri Lankan and Western options available, and three courses presented. They also went above and beyond for our toddler, providing pancakes and fruits. 

The staff are great and welcoming, and nothing was above them, which made the stay a wonderful experience. 

Overall, the Bartizan is still a great place to stay in the heart of Galle.
title: Perfect location in Galle Fort, but with

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
text: Clean comfortable room in the centre of Galle Fort. Excellent location and friendly staff. Aircon worked ok and good fridge with complimentary bottled water. No restaurant but breakfast was provided to the balcony outside our room. We had an early start and were slightly dubious whether it would arrive on time, but it did and was brought up by a friendly member of staff who was very obliging. Plenty of hot water and bed was very comfortable. More on the functional side but a good stop over for one night at the end of a 2 week holiday and about 2 hours drive up to the main Colombo airport.
title: Good hotel for a night in Galle Fort

text: The hotel was central to all attractions, the staff was very friendly and my room was clean and comfortable. placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
text:
I enjoyed my 3 day stay (room 22) in this small boutique hotel, just inside the walls of the Galle Fort. 
Great location, friendly helpful staff, really good breakfast and a large room with comfortable king size bed and a large balcony overlooking the internal courtyard. 

This hotel is expensive and owners / management need to pay attention to some small details in the hotel. 
During my 3 day stay the room was not made up, towels not replaced and water bottles not replaced (you can’t drink the tap water).  The hotel directory shows that the rooms will be made up every day, and towels will be replaced if they are left on the floor. I left the (please make up my room” sign o the door every day, but no one came into the room mover the 3 days. 
These are only small issues, and would not matter if you are paying $100 a night, but I would expect much better when I have paid over $240 a night
title: Nice boutique hotel in Galle

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
text: Fluffy pillows and bed , treated myself to my last night in Sri Lanka and stayed in the turret of the hotel with spectacular views in a quaint loft style conversion . Eveything small and neatly packaged with air con . Ok so it needed some fresh paint but didn’t take away the uniqueness which I loved . The staff were excellent and the breakfast was by far the best I have had in Sri Lanka ! I very much enjoyed the coconut and lime juice and enjoyed my stay ! I highly receimend this place and if you get up early around 6 am you can walk along the front about 150 yards and take to the top and watch the turtles come close to the rocks where they feed ! It’s a social place ! Thank you for a great stay !
title: Decadent Princess bedroom

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
text:
Bartizan is a lovely boutique hotel in a beautiful building in a great location within the Fort. Our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 young kids) booked the family room which was great as a suite, but probably not ideal for a family. The main bed is huge and comfortable, but the 2 single beds are located in an ante-room off the bedroom which doesn’t have A/C and the fan isn’t able to get much airflow as the beds are recessed into the structure, so it gets very hot. We overcame this by moving the mattress into the main bedroom but might not be for everyone. The view from the balcony is awesome, especially at sunset. 

Staff are very kind, warm and welcoming, which creates a nice atmosphere. Breakfast was great, abundant food with good western and Sri Lankan options.
title: Very nice boutique hotel in a great location within the Fort

ownerResponse:
{'id': '939074808', 'text': "Dear valued guests,

roomTip: Noisy dogs outside at night, but otherwise a nice hotel.
text: Our room was fabulous, it was a suite on the 1st floor.  Very well appointed and nicely furnished and pretty.  Unfortunately, nit the fault of the hotel, there was a power cut all night, so we roasted and had to open the balcony doors and windows which meant we were then bitten by mosquitos.  I hate to say all this because I know it was beyond there control but it did mean we had no sleep, also there was a lot of noise from dogs barking outside as well.
title: Very pretty and central hotel

ownerResponse:
{'id': '939074852', 'text': "Dear valued guest,

Thank you for your glowing review! We're thrilled to hear that you had such a wonderful experience at The Bartizan Hotel.

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
text:
Location, Location, Location!  Watching the sunset set over the Indian Ocean each night was magical from this Dutch Colonial boutique hotel inside the ramparts of Galle Fort.  Its footsteps from all the shop, restaurants and colonial history as you can possibly want. Rooms are great and staff are lovely.  The breakfast is epic!
One minor drag - as in most hotels in Europe - you cant plug anything in in the bathroom - so another mirror close to a plug in the bedroom area would be great (however I experienced this issue throughout Sri Lanka! - I guess no-one uses straighteners in SL?!!)  Would definitely stay here again!
title: Location, Location, Location!

placeInfo: {'id': '11789132', 'name': 'The Bartizan Galle Fort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 278, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.025552, 'longitude': 80.21601, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d11789132-Reviews-The_Bartizan_Galle_Fort-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebartizan.com', 'address': '77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '77 Pedlar Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 16, 'count4': 48, 'count5': 206}}
roomTip: The Balcony rooms have more luxery and service than the downstairs rooms. It makes a great difference in the experience
text:
This is a small boutique hotel in Galle with just the perfect balcony room. Yes, it is expensive, they have European roomrates. But they also have a great service, lovely staf, a different style luxe breakfast and complementairy tea and cake served at your own balcony in the afternoon. The room was beautifull and the cinnamon smell was also really nice. 
We stayed newyears eve at this hotel, and then we recommend earplugs for the noise of the celebrating crowd. But from the hotel it was a short walk up to the clocktower to see the fireworks. The owners did a great job redoing this place and turning it into a really charming hotel. Eventhough the downstairs rooms are small and without any view. When we visit the rain spoiled a little bit of the fun, I can imagen that the hotel even looks better when you also can use the little terras viewing the ocean.
title: Great experience

placeInfo: {'id': '24119924', 'name': 'Taavetti', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 17, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.038457, 'longitude': 80.20472, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d24119924-Reviews-Taavetti-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://villataavetti.com/', 'address': '266/10 Sea Breeze Garden Mahamodara, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '266/10 Sea Breeze Garden', 'street2': 'Mahamodara', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 0, 'count5': 16}}
text:
Taavetti is a small boutique style hotel but is actually newly refurbished in excellent quality. The place is very clean and tidy and the room was excellent. Its quiet and the staff are excellent neat and well mannered. We were received in an excellent way especially after a 2 hour drive from Colombo. We were offered fresh juice and a cool towel while checking in. Checking was straight forward and easy. The hotel has its own access to a beach and restaurant. We mainly had breakfast there. Its a set menu breakfast that gives u a choice of English French and Asian breakfasts. The location of the hotel is not where all the 5* hotels are but beaches are beautiful in most places and Taavetti has a nice stretch of beach with seating and umbrellas

The beach club itself looks outdated unlike the hotel itself. If they spice up the beach furniture to be more bright and colorful that would be good.
title: Fantastic little place that i would call a hidden gem

placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
text:
Another single night stay on our tree-week tour, another location we wish we could have had longer!

What a beautiful little gem in the heart of the fort, all of the staff were very attentive and friendly.  We ended up having dinner somewhere else in the fort but came back for dessert and a dessert cocktail.  the cocktail bar here is something else, two pages of bespoke inventive cocktails, we tried most of them between us in the two days and one night we were here ;)

We had breakfast and lunch here before checking out and all of the food was delicious and fresh, I had the prawn curry with bread and it was amazing.

The fort itself is very interesting to walk around and offers great views back into the main city and out to sea.
title: Luxury in the Fort.

text: We went to ropewalk restaurant for dinner and it was the best decision. Their menu had many great options whether it be healthy eating or something on the indulgence side as well. We went ahead with their pepper tofu salad and the chicken cabinet. The dishes were enough for 2 people and they served us with an entree as well. Unfortunately, I couldn’t take any pictures of the other dishes. Their service was really good and Thilini was a great waitress. The atmosphere was great and they have live music which was cherry in top. Definitely recommended this place.
title: Best dinner in the heart of Galle Fort

Probably the best hotel we've ever stayed in. Location is amazing, right in the middle of the fort. Nothing is more than about a 5-minute walk away.
The staff made us feel so special, nothing was too much trouble.
The food and the cocktails were superb. Room was great. So much to like.

text:
A truly amazing stay, the service was exemplary with a special mention to Dilip who is without question an asset to the hotel and looked after us so well! We stayed in the Garden Suite which was beautiful, spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable. The pool was just perfect to cool off after a hot day in Galle. The food was delicious and an arrack cocktail is a must try! Thank you so much for a great start to our Sri Lankan holiday!
 Ivan & Louise
title: Top hotel in Galle!

text:
Enjoyed the day at Galle while fishing and boating...
Galle is very famous for the Light House and the Galle Fort..
Its very interesting roaming around in the Galle Fort with antient type houses built.
There are small resturants all over and most home made stuff..
title: Sri Lanka Galle Fort

text:
A couple of us stayed here and we all loved the Galle Fort Hotel. I was lucky enough to be upgraded to the Library Suite, which was fabulous; some friends had the Porcelain Suite and a garden room - they were all great.
It was great to have the history of the building explained to us. It is very central inside Galle Fort and super easy to get around.
The staff were always lovely.
We ate lots of meals here and a number of drinks in the bar - all fabulous. 
I thought the prices of the rooms and food were exceptionally good for such a high standard of hotel.
title: Charming hotel, fabulous service.

ownerResponse: {'id': '962799462', 'text': "Hi Andrea,\n\nWe're sorry that it didn't live up to expectation for you, and that the cocktails perhaps weren't what you anticipated; we do try hard to incorporate local flavours and local ingredients, which may not have been what you were expecting.  Live entertainment is on Saturday evenings, rather than a daily event, as we don't want to overwhelm those who come in.  Our food menu is a modern take on traditional Sri Lankan dishes, and we think delicious, but everyone is free to choose what suits them best.  Perhaps on a return visit to Sri Lanka and to Galle, you will honour us by tucking into one of them?", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-08-02', 'responder': 'Claire Holman', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

Found it on Google and so we also decides to check out the place. 

They said there’s live music but when we came didn’t see any, the cocktails were average. The Food menu looks okay but decided to try out other restaurant since it is our last night in galle. 

The lobby looks interesting and they have a pool inside.

placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
roomTip: Try the amazing arrack cocktails in the bar
text:
-Nestled in the heritage site Galle fort itself, this Dutch colonial style boutique hotel was the perfect place to relax.
-We stayed at the grand apartment suite for 4 nights  & It was a fabulous experience. 
-The ropewalk bar had the most amazing cocktails and bartenders.
-The staff are top notch. House keeping was immaculate, to the point they worked in the background every day and ensured to change towels, set up the bed for the evening. 
-Service staff remembered little details of our preferences, and followed up every step of the way. They personalised our experience.
- The ambiance, comfort, location, food everything about the place was simply attentive, personal and elegant.
- This is a boutique hotel that has mastered hospitality.
title: Amazing hospitality and beautiful property

placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
roomTip: If you’re a family I highly recommend booking to stay in the Grand Apartment Suite as there is plenty of room, in fact it’s huge.
text: We stayed at the Galle Fort Hotel for our last 3 nights in Sr Lanka and it didn’t disappoint. It’s a beautiful heritage hotel with a central courtyard right in the centre of the fort itself close to shops, galleries, spas and every wonderful thing that the vibrant fort offers. The courtyard features ancient frangipani trees, a beautiful outdoor terrace for dining and a stunning pool tiled with green and blue mosaics. The whole scene feels like a peaceful oasis. The staff are  efficient and caring with the stand out being Roshan Rosa who provided our cooking lesson (reviewed separately). Our room the ‘Grand Apartment’ suite, was huge and elegant and easily accommodated an extra bed for our daughter in the enormous separate living room. In spite of the central location our room was really quiet with effective air conditioning so sleep was easy.  The bar is literally floor to ceiling choices and an extensive cocktail mix, the hotel restaurant is outstanding. We had a wonderful time staying here and highly recommend it.
title: Heritage oasis in the centre of the Galle Fort

placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
text:
This boutique hotel is stunning. Breakfast huge and delicious.  Sri Lankan curry is so good and the fish in banana leaves.  The staff are so friendly and went above and beyond in every way, everyone was so helpful. 
Dilan and Dilip and all the staff gave us impeccable service for our 3 day stay.  Oshadhi was so kind and helpful - she made our stay extra special, always available for a smile and help.  We will be back and I can’t recommend a hotel more highly.
title: Stunning hotel

text:

roomTip: Allow yourself enough time to sit on the front porch next to the bar, and watch the world go by, whilst sipping on a nice old drink.
text: Exceptional. My wife and I recently decided to escape to Sri Lanka for a long weekend and after some research decided that the old fort town of Galle would be great to visit. We booked a 3 night stay at the Galle Fort Hotel and were blown away by the building, the rooms, the atmosphere and the food. We could not have asked for a better place to base ourselves whilst explore the local area and then unwinding in the beautiful pool. We stayed in the Grand Apartment which was heavenly, with separate bath and shower area, a beautiful big 4 poster bed and a separate lounge area. A fantastic room. The hotel is located in the centre of the old fort town and is within easy walking distance of all the activities and sites. Whilst there are a number of good hotels in in area, we high recommend that you book into this hotel and truly enjoy your stay. As mentioned the food prepared and supervised by Chef Roshan is fantastic and if you ask him very nicely, he may even prepare for you his fantastic fish curry. It is not on the official menu, but i am sure that with the right  asking, he would prepare i for you. To sum it all up THIS PLACE IS FANTASTIC.
title: EXCEPTIONAL EXPERIENCE

roomTip:
Due to heritage requirements there aren’t many power points in rooms, so ask for or take a power board. 
Try some of the attack cocktails!
text: Galle Fort Hotel is in a fantastic location inside the old walled fort. The hotel is small and rooms are tucked away from the street. The courtyard with pool is inviting. We had 3 nights and enjoyed our chats with chef Roshan & waiter Dilip who were very helpful with menu suggestions. The breakfasts and curry dinners were excellent and our waitress Nethmi was charming. Management willingly changed our room from a loft room as the bathroom downstairs layout didn’t suit us.
title: Delightful heritage hotel in great location

text:
The Galle Fort Hotel would have to be one of the best hotels we have ever stayed out. The staff were outstanding and amazing with our young kids.
We stayed in the Garden Suite and it was perfect for quick dips in and out of the pool.
Location is perfect - right in the heart of the fort but so tranquil once inside.
The food was also amazing, be prepared for a big breakfast.
Would highly recommend and definitely will return if we return to Sri Lanka.
Huge thankyou to the staff for making it such a wonderful experience in Galle.
title: Hands down Amazing!

ownerResponse: {'id': '953502344', 'text': "Dear Guest,\n\nThank you for your feedback.  We are delighted that you got to explore the Fort, as well as sample some of the amenities the hotel provides, too.  As you say, the pool is not huge, but given that we are 1 of just 3 properties in the Fort with a pool, it's definitely an added advantage when looking for a place to stay!  Come back and stay again soon!", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-06-02', 'responder': 'Claire Holman', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
roomTip: Every room is different. Look on website before choosing, to see what suits you best (note that some have bed upstairs and bathroom down).
text: The hotel is in a fantastic location, right in the middle of Galle Fort. It's a magnificent old Dutch house, lovingly renovated, into luxurious and unique rooms. Mine was the Porcelain Suite, with a huge four poster bed, sofa, table, large bathroom and stunning furnishings. Nice touches like chocolates and other treats in the room. Not many other facilities, except a nice albeit small pool (which is a rare commodity in Galle Fort hotels). But no need for these, as you are right in the middle of many other options for spas, restaurants, etc. There's great food - the hotel has a really excellent restaurant and bar.  The breakfast was delicious, and the one dinner we ate in house was really something special. Have to note some of the best and most well-trained staff I've had the pleasure to encounter. I'd definitely recommend this hotel. Pricey, but worth every penny,
title: A beautiful and characterful luxury hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
text: While I didn't stay at the Galle Fort Hotel, I stumbled upon their bar, Ropewalk. It turned out to be a serendipitous moment, as I was served the best cocktail I've had in my seven days of travel in Sri Lanka. After a refreshing walk in Galle, I indulged in three drinks, with the assistance of Mr. Pasindu, who helped me pick the perfect concoction. The "only nabeel like this" was truly exceptional, as every single ingredient could be tasted. It was like listening to an orchestra, with each instrument playing in harmony, yet still distinguishable on their own.
title: Probably the best drinks you can get

Great coffee! And really fresh salads and local food! Coconut rotis the best!
The room was spacious and the pool really good size to be able to swim.

text:
We dined & drank at the Ropewalk bar on our first evening in Galle Fort and it was one of our highlights.

Our waiter Pasindu deserves a special mention as he provided amazing recommendations for both food & cocktails as well as being a warm, genuine and incredibly attentive host. 

We can’t wait to visit the bar again & hopefully stay at the hotel next time we visit Galle Fort.

text:

Food was delicious and service was great! Wish we could go back and stay again for a longer time. Perfect location to explore. We biked in and toured around on foot.

ownerResponse: {'id': '946612990', 'text': "Good morning Chris,\n\nThank you for your thoughtful review of your stay with us, and we are taking your feedback to heart.  Unfortunately, we do face a few limitations in what we can do, as the building as a national heritage foundation property, over 400 years old, and there are restrictions relating to building work.  Bearing that in mind, we have tailored our furnishings to suit the age of the property, whilst still making them as comfortable as possible, and with all the modern features that today's traveller requires.", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-04-13', 'responder': 'Claire Holman', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
roomTip: don't get the loft suites
text:
Galle Fort Hotel offers a conveniently central location in the heart of Galle, making it easy to explore the area on foot. However, it's important to adjust your expectations to the local context. Sri Lanka, while charming, is still developing, and this is reflected in the accommodations.

The hotel has about 12 rooms, and we stayed in a loft suite. Unfortunately, the layout was less than ideal, with a creaky staircase leading to the bed upstairs. The room itself was decent but dated. Despite this, it was comfortable and served its purpose.

The highlight of the hotel is its pool, which is quiet and easily accessible for guests. We only tried the breakfast, which was satisfactory and served in a pleasant setting overlooking the gardens. The staff, particularly our morning host Dilon, were polite and helpful.

Overall, Galle Fort Hotel has potential but could benefit from some tender loving care. With time and investment, it has the makings of a great accommodation option as tourism in the area continues to grow.
title: Galle Fort Hotel

text: The Galle Fort hotel is a lovely hotel. Rooms are unusual as they are historically preserved but are very comfortable. There is a nice swimming pool in the middle of the hotel quadrangle. The food was very good and the staff we all very helpful and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is in a central part of the fort so everything within it is just a short walk away. Our 3 night stay was excellent. Guy and Jane
title: The perfect place to stay within Galle fort.

text: Galle fort is a sophisticated offering with a wonderful converted merchants mansion around which a modern and beautiful hotel has been crafted. Amazing cocktail bar superb food, wonderful pool and such a comfortable room. Homely but so tasteful. Situated in the centre of the fort and other great eateries and shopping. This is a class act and very beautiful.

text:
We attended a wedding at the Galle fort hotel in January and, even though we did not stay at the hotel, we experienced the hospitality and the outstanding service over the 3 days.
The bartenders at the rope walk bar made the most amazing drinks. I enjoyed many gin cocktails and bottles of Lion larger. The Smore Beef and the Prawn and mustard salad were excellent.
It was a memorable and wonderful experience.
title: Amazing

text:
Hotel room was not what we expected. Very small and cramped for 2 people. Hotel full so could not move rooms. Not suitable for 2 nights at all.
Dinner very slow service.
Live music was so loud you could not talk to your partner . After asking the second night will be the same too!
 Very very disappointed with the whole stay.
Had some lovely hotels as we travelled round sri Lanka but this is not one of them

Not a good send off back to America it has left a bad memory.
One more night to go!

text:
Quirky and comfortable in the best location  ! 
Room was amazingly cool in temperature was so so welcome as Galle is humid and it smelt divine ! 
Staff were so welcoming and being in the middle of the bustling streets of the fort in Galle was an amazing experience

placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
roomTip: Book early!
text:
While having a drink at this hotel's beautiful bar we enquired it  would be possible to join a personal cooking class. Following a brief discussion with a member of staff we were asked to attend at 0900 the following morning. 

On arrival it dawned on us that we would be the only two participants for this experience. 

Shiromal and his two colleagues (the chef and driver) gave us an outline of the morning and then the fun began. 

We were driven to the local fish market and asked to choose our favourite seafood. With this duly purchased our next stop was the fruit and vegetable market where the merits of each variety of produce was explained. Loaded with the freshest foods imaginable we headed back to base. 

The following two hours were a delight where step-by-step we were shown how to add each spice and flavour to our respective dishes. We dined on the resultant 7 dishes comprising traditional curries of prawn, beetroot and vegetables together with delicious side dishes, all the time being treated as VIP guests.

We could not thank our hosts sufficiently and I hope that Shiromal and his team appreciates what a wonderful experience it was for us. If you get the opportunity to try this you will not be disappointed.
title: Cookery Experience at Galle Fort Hotel

ownerResponse: {'id': '937492213', 'text': 'Dear guest,\n\nWe are warmed beyond words by your eloquent review - thank you!  It was a delight to have you stay, and we are grateful for your recommendation to future visitors. placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
text:
From the moment I stepped into the Galle Fort Hotel, I was transported into a world that blends the rich history of Galle Fort with the modern things we expect from a hotel.

The Hotel, with its meticulously restored architecture, stands as a testament to the fort's colonial past. The ambiance is enchanting, with a fusion of Dutch and British influences evident in its elegant décor and design.

We stayed in a Loft room for two nights. The room was well appointed, offering a blend of antique charm and modern amenities. The room, over two levers had high ceilings, wooden floorboards, and bespoke furniture which added to the overall sense of being in a bygone era.

The restaurant offered a variety of local and international dishes, all prepared with fresh, local ingredients. The flavours were amazing albeit a bit spicy for me. Dining in the hotel's courtyard, surrounded by the glow of lanterns and the gentle evening breeze, was both romantic and serene.

We also spent early evenings during our two night stay enjoying a sunset cocktail at Ropewalk, the hotels bar. The bar has been named as one of the Top 20 Bars in Sri Lanka. It is definitely worth enjoying a cocktail or two as you sit on the front veranda of the hotel, watching the hustle and bustle of the street.

Beyond the hotel, the location within Galle Fort offers easy access to explore the cobblestone streets, historic buildings, and shops that make this area so unique. The hotel's proximity to key attractions, including the Galle Lighthouse and the Dutch Reformed Church, made it easy to immerse ourselves in the culture and history of Galle.

Definitely recommend Galle Fort Hotel if you are thinking of a stay in Galle.
title: Galle Fort Hotel - Great Hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
roomTip: Garden rooms are great but ask for No.1!
text:
By far and away our favourite hotel in Sri Lanka. Cultural heritage in this quaint boutique hotel - small and efficient. Our garden room by the pool (No.1) was airy, beautifully decorated and practical as well as being a few steps from the pool.
Breakfast served (not buffet) was lovely served by lovely staff.
The Ropewalk bar in the evening is popular and a great place to watch the world go by.
Highly recommend and wish we had stayed longer since Galle has so much to offer and explore.
title: Wonderful boutique hotel, pleasant staff and lovely breakfast

text: Stayed here with my Fiancé and parents on New Years Eve.  We really liked Galle, with lots of great places to eat and drink.  The hotel is very colonial.  It is in excellent condition.  The rooms were well maintained although the layout was a little strange.  The bedroom was upstairs, however, the bathroom was with the living area downstairs.  Not great if nature calls in the night!  There is a lovely bar near the front door that serves excellent cocktails.   The service was great.  The staff were very friendly and attentive.   Dinner was a special New Years Eve set menu.  The food was superb!
title: Top Hotel in Galle

placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
text:
We popped in for a cocktail at the Ropewalk bar. We didn't stay in a room.

We sat on the terrace and were quickly brought a menu by a really friendly waiter. 

The cocktail list isn't huge but it's good and the pricing isn't too bad. 

I had "Only Nabeel Likes This", apparently the rest of his team don't like it....they obviously have poor taste compared to Nabeel as this was a damn fine tasting cocktail. 

Karen had a Smoked Marmalade, and it was really really good. 

Sitting on the balcony watching the street pass you by did evoke a sense of yesteryear.

Highly recommended
title: Great cocktails

placeInfo: {'id': '556080', 'name': 'Galle Fort Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1058, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.026645, 'longitude': 80.21746, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d556080-Reviews-Galle_Fort_Hotel-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.galleforthotel.com/', 'address': '28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '28 Church Street', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 79, 'count4': 210, 'count5': 730}}
text: This hotel is in a very old building built by the Dutch. Our room was very narrow and very dark and gloomy with very little natural light. The bathroom was tiny and the shower needed a good clean. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights - we would have moved out after the first night, however we had pre-paid via our travel company - that was the only reason we stayed. The hotel has an open air restaurant/bar very close to the rooms and it played live music until around midnight each of the nights we were there. The music was really terrible quality and very loud so we got little sleep. The bathroom for the restaurant had no soap or hand towels or hand dryer. The food was very ordinary quality however the portions were generous. For breakfast, you had to serve yourself tea and coffee from an urn. I do not recommend this hotel.
title: Loud live music every night

roomTip:
Book the Apartment Suite.
Stay for Dinner and Drinks.
text:
We had an overnight stay at the Galle Fort Hotel.

Our apartment suite was very spacious and decorated.

We had a wonderful evening with the best live music in the Island along with unique cocktails.

The service was exceptional and we enjoyed this boutique hotel in the historic town of Galle

roomTip: Wife visited  Spa called Tonic Health and wellness centre and had full body massage and following body scrub & facial .
text:
Authentic review

We recently stayed at Fort Bliss for one night, and it was an exceptional experience. From the warm, friendly welcome to the relaxing atmosphere, everything made our stay memorable. Located in the heart of a World Heritage site, it’s the perfect spot for those wanting a blend of history and comfort.

Our room (Room 4) was quiet, away from the busy areas, yet close enough to restaurants, art galleries, and the spa, making it a convenient location to explore. Breakfast was fresh and delicious, served with a smile, adding to the charm of the stay.
title: First time stay

placeInfo: {'id': '2256613', 'name': 'Fort Bliss Galle', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 562, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.02471, 'longitude': 80.217094, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d2256613-Reviews-Fort_Bliss_Galle-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.fortblissgalle.com/', 'address': '84 Lighthouse Street Fort, Galle 1992 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '84 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': 'Fort', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '1992'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 17, 'count4': 150, 'count5': 384}}
roomTip: Parking out back if you can find one.
text:
Beautifully run small boutique guest house inside the Gall Fort.
Fort Bliss is managed by two absolute gentlemen - Sunil & Imran.
These two guys made us feel more than welcome at all times, anticipating and attending to the smallest details without request. 
The breakfast is best in Sri Lanka. Very tasty and beautifully presented. Enough to get you through to dinner time.
Rooms are clean and fresh towels and water are available whenever required. 
This lovely little place is close to restaurants and the Fort Walls for your discovery walks around the town inside the Fort.
I highly recommend this charming little Guest House and I would stay again to see our new friends on a return trip to Galle.
title: Aussies in Bliss - Fort Bliss, Galle.

placeInfo: {'id': '2256613', 'name': 'Fort Bliss Galle', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 562, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.02471, 'longitude': 80.217094, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d2256613-Reviews-Fort_Bliss_Galle-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.fortblissgalle.com/', 'address': '84 Lighthouse Street Fort, Galle 1992 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '84 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': 'Fort', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '1992'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 17, 'count4': 150, 'count5': 384}}
text:
Very nice place, authentic and central. One of the best breakfast in Sri Lanka served by 2 kind hosts. Fresh juice, eggs, fruits and homemade other dishes. The room was spacious and well decorated.
Many thanks. We recommend for sure for one night in Galle Fort.
title: A good experience hidden inside the fort

placeInfo: {'id': '2256613', 'name': 'Fort Bliss Galle', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 562, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.02471, 'longitude': 80.217094, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d2256613-Reviews-Fort_Bliss_Galle-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.fortblissgalle.com/', 'address': '84 Lighthouse Street Fort, Galle 1992 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '84 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': 'Fort', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '1992'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 17, 'count4': 150, 'count5': 384}}
text: We stayed 1 night and loved it, great location down a quiet street right next to the fort walls.  The hospitality was fabulous, such friendly staff who looked after us very well and gave us a delicious breakfast.  Galle is a great place to visit.
title: Fabulous stay

placeInfo: {'id': '2256613', 'name': 'Fort Bliss Galle', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 562, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.02471, 'longitude': 80.217094, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d2256613-Reviews-Fort_Bliss_Galle-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.fortblissgalle.com/', 'address': '84 Lighthouse Street Fort, Galle 1992 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '84 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': 'Fort', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '1992'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 17, 'count4': 150, 'count5': 384}}
text: It's unbelievable that this hotel only has 3 stars! We've stayed in several 4-star hotels on this vacation that didn't offer the same level of service. The hosts are incredibly friendly and always ready to help. The rooms are clean and very spacious. The bed is heavenly, and I especially love the many thick pillows! The bathroom is also spacious and clean, with various products and even a hairdryer. Aside from the sea view and the wonderful hosts, the best part of this hotel is definitely the breakfast. You get a huge selection of fruit, a smoothie, tea and/or coffee, an egg cooked to your liking with various vegetables and herbs, yogurt, and toast with butter and marmalade. The only small downside is that they are very strict about electricity usage, which I understand, but there's no need to remind us every time we come downstairs. Otherwise, it’s absolutely sublime!
title: Lovely!

placeInfo: {'id': '2256613', 'name': 'Fort Bliss Galle', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 562, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.02471, 'longitude': 80.217094, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d2256613-Reviews-Fort_Bliss_Galle-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.fortblissgalle.com/', 'address': '84 Lighthouse Street Fort, Galle 1992 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '84 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': 'Fort', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '1992'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 17, 'count4': 150, 'count5': 384}}
text: This was a wonderful place to stay, and lovely to come back to after a hot day walking around Galle. We had the end room and loved our view over the sea. The hosts were very welcoming and the breakfasts were amazing. Also recommend the Indian Hut restaurant just around the corner.
title: Delightful place to stay and delicious breakfasts

placeInfo: {'id': '2256613', 'name': 'Fort Bliss Galle', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 562, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.02471, 'longitude': 80.217094, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d2256613-Reviews-Fort_Bliss_Galle-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.fortblissgalle.com/', 'address': '84 Lighthouse Street Fort, Galle 1992 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '84 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': 'Fort', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '1992'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 17, 'count4': 150, 'count5': 384}}
text: This small hotel was in a great location in the Old Town. We enjoyed walking all around the area. We had  very comfortable room and our host served us a delicious breakfast in the morning. We felt so welcome that it felt like we were visiting a friend.
title: Well worth a visit

placeInfo: {'id': '2256613', 'name': 'Fort Bliss Galle', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 562, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.02471, 'longitude': 80.217094, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d2256613-Reviews-Fort_Bliss_Galle-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.fortblissgalle.com/', 'address': '84 Lighthouse Street Fort, Galle 1992 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '84 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': 'Fort', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '1992'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 17, 'count4': 150, 'count5': 384}}
roomTip: Be prepared to pay more for basic things like meals/drinks etc. Galle Fort is a bit of a tourist trap, but lovely and worth a visit.
text: Beautiful old building in the heart of Galle Fort, close and easy walking to everything within the Fort (very warm of course!). We had a great room with a sea view, the road can be noisy during the day but soon quietens down at bed time. Room was clean and tidy, great shower. A/C and fan in room were ok and kept the temp comfortable. The staff were really friendly and helpful and made an amazing breakfast. I would recommend Fort Bliss as a good base for a few days exploring.
title: Great little guesthouse in the heart of Galle Fort

placeInfo: {'id': '2256613', 'name': 'Fort Bliss Galle', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 562, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.02471, 'longitude': 80.217094, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d2256613-Reviews-Fort_Bliss_Galle-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.fortblissgalle.com/', 'address': '84 Lighthouse Street Fort, Galle 1992 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '84 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': 'Fort', 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '1992'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 17, 'count4': 150, 'count5': 384}}
text:
Great heritage hotel within Galle Fort. 
Super good location. A couple minutes. Walk to the rampart of the fort. Excellent friendly staff always attentive and eager to help in anyway.
The room was excellent, and the bed was supremely comfortable.
It was a great  find!
title: Two nights at Fort Bliss in old Galle Fort

text: Visited for a private lunch party in the stunning setting overlooking the Indian Ocean in Charlie’s Bar. Fantastic attentive and friendly staff who catered for our every need, delicious food and drink. I just wish we could have stayed longer! The manager had that capable air about him. placeInfo: {'id': '26325123', 'name': 'The Charleston', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 25, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.024788, 'longitude': 80.21709, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d26325123-Reviews-The_Charleston-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.wearecreativeleap.com/en/destinations/the-charleston', 'address': '78 Lighthouse Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '78 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 1, 'count5': 23}}
text:
We had a wonderful 2 night stay at the Charleston Hotel. 

A great hotel and very central in Galle. The staff are very welcoming and ensured us nothing was too much trouble. You are even provided with a mobile to take with you when you are out and about to keep in contact with the hotel. 
The hotel opened in January  2024 and has all the mod cons you would expect from a modern hotel.
All staff go the extra mile and only too willing to help with anything they can. It is almost nothing is impossible. 
You can even have your laundry done and this is included free of charge, providing you stay a couple of days. 
Breakfast is Al la carte and a short menu. As we needed to have gluten free, at breakfast we had mango bread on our first day and the second day coconut bread. Yummy!
My only comment there is not much of a choice of the local cuisine on both the breakfast and dinner menu.
Would definitely stay at this hotel when in Galle.
title: A lovely two night stay

placeInfo: {'id': '26325123', 'name': 'The Charleston', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 25, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.024788, 'longitude': 80.21709, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d26325123-Reviews-The_Charleston-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.wearecreativeleap.com/en/destinations/the-charleston', 'address': '78 Lighthouse Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '78 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 1, 'count5': 23}}
text: Tucked in down Lighthouse Street within the fort at Galle you’ll find the Charleston, and what a find it is! It’s a modern boutique hotel with fantastic rooms and amazing bathrooms. And there’s even a pool! The staff were welcoming, helpful, and accommodating. Breakfast can be taken in the dining room or on the terrace overlooking the sea. It’s good and served from a small a la carte menu. The hotel decor is to an exceptionally high standard, reflecting the art deco theme, and it was immaculately clean. As an added bonus the first floor terrace faces west where you can enjoy the spectacular views of the sunset whilst sipping the hotel’s signature cocktails. If you’re looking to stay an exceedingly good hotel within the walls of Galle Fort, I’d highly recommend the Charleston
title: Fantastic Hotel

roomTip: Call the hotel in advance to help with parking of your car.
text: We spent three weeks driving around Sri Lanka and, with a few days left before heading to the Maldives, decided to explore the southern province. Despite May not being the ideal season to visit the southwest, our experience at The Charleston at Galle Fort more than compensated for it. From the moment we arrived, we were treated to exceptional hospitality that truly set The Charleston apart. I hold top elite status with several hotel chains and have stayed in numerous premium five-star hotels, but the level of service here was on another level. The staff went above and beyond in every aspect, from the warm welcome at check-in to the personalized attention throughout our stay. The location, just south of Galle Fort, serves as an excellent base for exploring the area.
title: Art Deco Delight in Galle Fort

text:
Excellent Hotel, my husband and I stayed here on our last night in Galle before flying back home.  The rooftop bar gave us a spectacular view of the last sunset with some very tastefully done cocktails. 
The room was very clean and the bed was super comfy. The staff were out of this world. We had to leave the hotel at 5am to go to the airport so they kindly made us a packed breakfast of fresh fruit and delicious bakery goods and they also arranged a morning coffee for us before we left. Very rare to get service like that these days. We will be back 😊
title: Fantastic boutique Hotel

roomTip: the sunset terrace fills up pretty quick so snag a table as early as possible.
text:
Clean and cool, the Charleston offers great food, sharp rooms and impeccable service. I stayed for two nights, enjoyed the sunset over the terrace, the excellent coffee and heavenly food. The Italian chef was incredible. The air conditioned dining room is a welcome attraction, particularly for someone who has been exploring the fort and walking it's walls. 
The Charleston is a beautifully restored facade with an ultra modern boutique hotel behind.
title: Cool oasis in Galle Fort

text: Walking around the fort near Sunset we stumble the prawn this redeveloped residence. The bar is on the top floor overlooking the west over the ramparts. The wine list is quite reasonable with some wine by the glass and a beer was only ₹700 and a glass of rosé was about ₹2600.
title: Great Rooftop Bar

placeInfo: {'id': '26325123', 'name': 'The Charleston', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 25, 'locationString': 'Galle, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.024788, 'longitude': 80.21709, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297896-d26325123-Reviews-The_Charleston-Galle_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.wearecreativeleap.com/en/destinations/the-charleston', 'address': '78 Lighthouse Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '78 Lighthouse Street', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Galle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 1, 'count5': 23}}
text:
We stayed at the Charleston during our recent trip to Sri Lanka as a group of six and stayed in the courtyard rooms. It was hands down the best stay of our trip. From the outset Dilani and the Charleston team went out of their way to make us feel welcome and at home. Loved the touches such as the cardamom cookie and cashews on arrival, which were delicious. The team were super accommodating and helped us organise day tours and an in-house massage and yoga mats for our use, which were much appreciated.

The hotel itself is gorgeously restored with thoughtful design details and everything is immaculately clean. The courtyard rooms are spacious and well appointed. Turn down service was very thoughtful and loved the “fun facts” about Galle /Sri Lanka, the milk toffee and cute towel arrangements. We really enjoyed dining at Charlie’s Bar (ate there almost exclusively during our stay), with an amazing breakfast, lunch and dinner menu (with Sri Lankan and western options). All the dishes we tried were delicious and the seafood and Sri Lankan options were particularly good. The restaurant has a lovely ambience, with stunning views and a great place to try the creative and delicious cocktails (we loved the lemongrass gin offering). Prasanna and the team were super accommodating for all our different requests and always very kind and generous. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend the Charleston to anyone staying in Galle Fort and was certainly a highlight of the trip for us! Thanks again to the Charleston team for a wonderful stay.
title: Best stay of the trip

text: Happened upon this hotel whilst exploring the streets of Galle and popped in for a light lunch. Super friendly staff and delicious food and the design and attention to detail of the interiors is spot on. We shared the small plates squid and the Salmon Poke bowl and would highly recommend!

text:
We couldn't fault this hotel. Amazing service, absolutely pristine rooms and really good food! The breakfast menu is to die for, with a wide range of options that change each day. Our room was kept perfectly clean and during the turn-down service, the staff left a little box with a piece of fudge in and a fun fact about the hotel / Sri Lanka. This also changed daily, so the attention to detail here is second to none!
If you're in Galle looking for the best hotel in the centre of the Fort, or just want to watch the sunset with a cocktail - this is the place to go.
title: Absolutely fantastic!
